description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 4.4: Coordination and Innovation Effective contribution by the GoU- UNICEF Country Programme to UNICEF commitments in the UNDAF and corollary objectives in the National Development Plan and programme delivery, monitoring, reporting and access to basic services enhanced through development of innovative technological approaches, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Early Childhood Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Y108 - Programme Component Results (PCR) 4 Cross SectoralIn target districts schools, health facilities and communities in emergency settings have improved water and sanitation facilities o and Community Led Total Sanitation (CLTS) is introduced in target villages.b) Increased influence of youth on national agenda for realization child rights, effective participatory communication processes for child focused behavioural and social change and increased awareness at national and international levels of situation of children and women in Uganda.c) Responsiveness of UN Delivery-As- One to child rights and development/scaling up of technological innovative approaches for improved service delivery, accountability and transparency.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
HQ and RO technical support to multiple Goal Areas

description.narrative: Other General Services other general services

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals

UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 4.4: Coordination and Innovation Effective contribution by the GoU- UNICEF Country Programme to UNICEF commitments in theUNDAF and corollary objectives in the National Development Plan and programme delivery, monitoring, reporting; and access to basicservices enhanced through development of innovative technological approaches
4.4.1 No. of UN joint programmes developed and implemented on schedule

actual.value: 2013:8 developed and implemented so far. Two ended in 2012 and 6 are ongoing.
